title: Normal URF Times and Exam Conflicts...
body:
So I know it's Oct 28-Nov11, Unfortunately this is the EXACT time frame my exams start-finish. 

Usually exams are on Oct 28 - Nov20.  Perhaps, is there a chance we can get the times changed, or at least extended? I Find it pretty sad how most of us are going to miss out, just because Americans don't have exams. The timing is just uncanny...

replies.body:
A singular person, has a minute issue, expects multi-billion dollar company to bend for their will.

Just fucking procrastinate, i have exams too (University tier btw, so more important that what i can only suspect is High School exams based on the block period), doesn't mean i'm going to say "Hey Riot, can you change time's pls because i have exams"

I don't know many people (short of Straight A students, and even then...) that will not play video games during exam periods, Gaming is a way too destress before/after an exam, so no, nothing's gonna change, just procrastinate like the rest of us

I mean,
Postgraduate exams and research deadlines? Yeah that's probably a bigger priority in life than a highschool exam.
Undergraduate exams for a bachelors level topic? Eh, I'd probably say unless you're borderline failing, the highschool exam might have actually been more important.

If you're really trying to go for a competitive career, undergrad uni is probably the only break you'll be having before being an adult catches up to you. Trust me, the difference between undergrad and postgrad is like the difference between lemonade and coffee.

Personally I probably can't afford to play too much URF Lethality Poppy, and that's a real shame. I do hope Riot does give us an extension, though I doubt it, and I can accept the reasons they won't.

But don't shame the kid for asking.

Unfortunately, I doubt there's anything that can be done.

There's a few reason why Riot wouldn't be inclined to change times for this. As IVIemories said, the scheduled URF time is part of the 10th anniversary celebration, and it kicks off on the day that LoL originally went into open beta 10 years ago. It's also possible that they have things scheduled just after (or close to the end of) URF, and any delay with URF could then negatively affect their plans going forward.

Another thing to consider is that URF as a mode ("classic" URF in particular) is a bit notorious for causing large sums of players to actually leave the game, for various reasons, and Riot wouldn't want to risk losing too many players by extending the availability of the mode.

There's also the fact that OCE just isn't as popular of a region as others, and NA in particular. We've always been a bit of a "niche" region, and while I think the OCE Rioters do their best to have our region heard, it's just a bit impractical for Riot to change their plans solely(?) around us.

It's possible that Riot may consider an extension for the mode, depending on how this experiment of theirs goes, but the expectation (as far as I'm concerned) will be that this is the last time we'll have classic URF for a *long* time, and nothing is going to change the set time frame.

Personally, I'd love to see some consideration regarding this on Riot's part, but realistically there are too many factors that would make that too impractical, not enough of a pay-off for the effort and trouble it would take.

It sucks how they don't allocate stuff based on time of region. 

At least the NA team should have acknowledged exams around the world and allocated a more suitable time zone. 

The only thing that concerns me is they'll start saying "oh, but classic URF isn't as popular as ARURF, based on our statistics" which may not even be the case. Due to the time frame it was given... At least if they enabled it for a full MONTH, then it may be better for everyone. It sucks that I'll be missing out on this. I waited 4 years for this to happen, and now I'm missing out...
Just go and play on PBE.

if you want success in life, focus your exam.
if u like video games so much, just fail it or dont sit for it. Its that simple.
it depends on what you want.
I agree, why are there not allocated time frames equivalent to that of the Americans for each respective region. That's pretty bad way to snub the rest of the world.
This is for the 10th anniversary, I highly doubt riot is going to to change the time for this.
